name: searchentries
description:
This is a sub-function API for tool lexicala.
Tool description: Lexicala API is a REST interface offering access to dictionary and lexical data from our monolingual, bilingual, multilingual and learner’s dictionaries in JSON format.
API description: Search for entries with various filters in the query.

sample.description: Number of randomly-sampled results to return.

source.description: The resource to search within. The default value is 'global', i.e. the Global series

language.description: The language code of the entry’s language. For an extensive list of language codes, see GET /languages

analyzed.description: Whether to search using the language analyzer or to get exact matches only. The default value is 'false'

subcategorization.description: The subcategorization (e.g. countable, transitive, …) to search for

polysemous.description: Whether to only return polysemous entries.

pos.description: The part of speech (POS) to search for.

gender.description: The grammatical gender to search for.

monosemous.description: Whether to only return monosemous entries.

morph.description: Whether to search in headword inflections if exist. The default value is 'false'

text.description: The headword text to search for.

number.description: The grammatical number to search for.

page.description: Page number of results to return (1-indexed). The default value is 1
